title: Removing a working set immediately causes changes in package view filtering
description: When a working set is removed, the package view is immediately refiltered in the background. However, in my opinion, the refiltering should only occur when closing the working set selection dialog, not during manipulation. Additionally, I believe that pressing cancel should cancel any changes made to the working sets, including the removal of a working set.
OB: 1. Create a working set with one project and select it. The package view should be filtered accordingly.
EB: When a working set is removed, the package view should not immediately refilter in the background. Instead, the refiltering should only occur when the working set selection dialog is closed. Furthermore, pressing cancel should revert any changes made to the working sets, including the removal of a working set.
SR:
1. Create a working set with one project and select it.
2. Remove the working set.
3. Observe that the package view does not immediately refilter.
4. Close the working set selection dialog.
5. Observe that the package view now refilters.
6. Press cancel and verify that the working set is not removed and any changes made are reverted.
